taskDefinition.name: AWS EC2 Create Route
taskDefinition.author: support@kineticdata.com
taskDefinition.description: Creates a route in the route table within a VPC. For more information see the AWS Amazon Virtual Private Cloud User Guide online.

parameter.label: Dry Run
parameter.tooltip: true or false. Dry run validates user permissions. Error response will be 'DryRunOperation' if the account has the proper permissions; 'UnauthorizedOperation' if the account does not have the proper permissions.

parameter.label: Route Table Id
parameter.tooltip: The ID of the route table in which the ROUTE. Must match an existing value in AWS.

parameter.label: Destination CIDR Block
parameter.tooltip: The CIDR address block used for the destination match. AWS routing decision are based on the most specific match.

parameter.label: Gateway ID
parameter.tooltip: One of 'Gateway ID', 'NAT Instance ID', 'VPC Peering Connection ID', or 'Network Interface ID' must be provided. Gateway ID is the ID of an Internet gateway or virtual private gateway attached to your VPC.

parameter.label: NAT Instance ID
parameter.tooltip: One of 'Gateway ID', 'NAT Instance ID', 'VPC Peering Connection ID', or 'Network Interface ID' must be provided. NAT Instance ID is the ID of a NAT instance in your VPC. This operation will fail if you specify an instance ID unless exactly one network interface is attached.

parameter.label: VPC Peering Connection ID
parameter.tooltip: One of 'Gateway ID', 'NAT Instance ID', 'VPC Peering Connection ID', or 'Network Interface ID' must be provided. VPC Peering Connection ID is the ID of a VPC peering connection.

parameter.label: Network Interface ID
parameter.tooltip: One of 'Gateway ID', 'NAT Instance ID', 'VPC Peering Connection ID', or 'Network Interface ID' must be provided. Network Interface ID is the ID of a network interface.
